unit_learning_outcomes.description: develop sophisticated research skills and an ability to manage an extended research and writing project
formulate arguments and express ideas at an advanced level
reflect upon the process of research and on scholarly debates
demonstrate skill in evaluating ancient source material and modern interpretations of that source material at an advanced level
acquire knowledge of historical developments and historiography relevant to chosen topic

enrolment_rules.description: Admission to BAncHist or to BArch and 130cp at 1000 level or above

assessments.description: Students are to submit a short (750–1000 words) review of a book or major article (30+ pages) which is central to their chosen field of study.
Timed oral presentation on the results of your research

Students are to submit an annotated bibliography of modern works on their chosen area of research together with a research plan (of no more than 300 words) outlining the proposed research project. The annotations and research plan should not be more than 1500–2000 words overall.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Infrequent attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Fully online/virtual
Session 2, Special circumstances, North Ryde
data.subject_search_title: AHIS3000 - Capstone in Ancient History and Archaeology
data.description: Students will undertake extended research on a topic arising from an AHIS unit which they have previously completed, and produce a research project which will be presented orally at a unit mini-conference and as a written paper (2500-3000 words). In preparation for the larger research project students will submit an annotated bibliography and research plan together with a review of a book relevant to the project. Students must contact the unit convenor by the first week of the session to obtain approval for their topic.
